abstract.p: Finnish cellular phone company Nokia signs $300 million contract to supply Philippine cellular operator Smart Communications with equipment to expand Smart's digital network (S)

block.p: The Finnish cellular phone company Nokia signed a $300 million contract to supply the Philippine cellular operator Smart Communications with equipment to expand Smart's digital network. Smart, which runs an analog network that was once the country's most popular, has embarked on a $401 million program this year to double its capacity to four million users and prepare for new wireless Internet services. A unit of Philippine Long Distance Telephone, Smart now uses a network based on the global system for mobile communications that is predominant in Europe and Asia.
